required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cross Sectional Study to Evaluate Effects of Kinesiotaping on Muscle Activity During Climbing Stairs and Sport Activity
clinical_study.official_title: Cross Sectional Study to Evaluate the Effects of Kinesio IQ-Tape, Kinesiotaping and no Taping on Muscle Activation and Reflex Activity During Climbing Stairs, Drop Jump and Running With 10, 12 and 15km/h

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the effects of IQ-Tape, Kinesiotaping and no Taping on muscle activity during daily activity and sport activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Muscle activity of the quadriceps muscles during drop-jump, running and climbing stairs.
primary_outcome.description: RMS-values of quadriceps muscles during, drop-jump, running with 10, 12 and 15km/h and stair climbing: pre-activation-phase: 50ms before ground-contact post-activation-phase: from 0 to 30ms and 30 to 150 ms after ground-contact

secondary_outcome.measure: Muscle activity of the hamstrings muscles during drop-jump, running and climbing stairs
secondary_outcome.description: RMS-values of hamstrings muscles during, drop-jump, running with 10, 12 and 15km/h and stair climbing: pre-activation-phase: 50ms before ground-contact post-activation-phase: from 0 to 30ms and 30 to 150 ms after ground-contact

secondary_outcome.measure: Muscle activity of the soleus muscles during drop-jump, running and climbing stairs
secondary_outcome.description: RMS-values of soleus muscles during, drop-jump, running with 10, 12 and 15km/h and stair climbing: pre-activation-phase: 50ms before ground-contact post-activation-phase: from 0 to 30ms and 30 to 150 ms after ground-contact

secondary_outcome.measure: Muscle activity of the tibialis muscles during drop-jump, running and climbing stairs
secondary_outcome.description: RMS-values of tibialis muscles during, drop-jump, running with 10, 12 and 15km/h and stair climbing: pre-activation-phase: 50ms before ground-contact post-activation-phase: from 0 to 30ms and 30 to 150 ms after ground-contact

secondary_outcome.measure: Muscle activity of the gastrocnemius muscles during drop-jump, running and climbing stairs
secondary_outcome.description: RMS-values of gastrocnemius muscles during, drop-jump, running with 10, 12 and 15km/h and stair climbing: pre-activation-phase: 50ms before ground-contact post-activation-phase: from 0 to 30ms and 30 to 150 ms after ground-contact

intervention.description: RMS-values of leg muscles at pre-activation (50ms) before ground-contact and post-activation 0-30ms and 30 - 150ms after ground-contact during drop-jump, running and stair climbing.
RMS-values of leg muscles at pre-activation (50ms) before ground-contact and post-activation 0-30ms and 30 - 150ms after ground-contact during drop-jump, running and stair climbing.
RMS-values of leg muscles at pre-activation (50ms) before ground-contact and post-activation 0-30ms and 30 - 150ms after ground-contact during drop-jump, running and stair climbing.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy
- able to perform daily activities and sport performance
Exclusion Criteria:
- lower body and pelvic injuries
- fractures of the spine oder lower limb
- cardiac or neurological diseases

facility.name: Bern University of Applied Sciences, Department Health
